ATLANTIC SOUVENIR


FOR 1923.

THIS Institution will be opened Monday


the ED. Of October Inst, under the care


oithe Rev. JOSEPH WILsoy.


In this Seminary students will he thoroughly in
strueed in the different branches of a good English
aud Classical Education, viz Reading, Writing
Arithmetic, English Grammar, Geography, Compo-
sition. Eocution, Mathematics. and the Greek ana
Latin Languages The terms of tuition will be for
the English branches, exclusive of Mathematics.
SO per session, or $40, including the Mathematics;
for the Languages, including the English, $40 per
session. Tuition money to be paid in advance.
There will be two sessions in the year. with "A
short vacation between EACH


Good boarding can be obtained in respectable
families in the village, at the rate Of Forty Dollars
per session and few hoarders can be accommo.
dated in the family of the Principal.


JOHN EDDOWES. Sec'v.

full articles.headline:
NOtice
TO JUSTICES OF TIE PEACE.
full articles.article:
THE Justices OF the.Peace in the several counties
Of this State hereby requested TO make their re-
turns Of the fines, imposed by them, also the name,
of the Constables, who had the collection OF sa'a
fines.


Those Justices of the Peace, who have neglected
to make their returns for several years past are r.
Quested to make return OF all the fines imposed by
them since their last return


Attention TO this notice is requested, as repof'
will be made to the Legislature OF all those who Dts
lect TO make their report according to Law.
Also the Road Commissioners of the County O
Newcastle, who have moi made their returns OF i've
expenditures on Roads and Bridges, in their resptf'
tive hundyed for the year of 1896, are requested 10
forward them as soon as convenient.


S. WILLIAMS,
.auditor Of JAceornss State IF Delasvarf'
Oct. 31sf, 1897 ST.
